website_summaries.verdict: One of the best resources for getting a handle on the PMP exam and becoming comfortable with many of the concepts.
pros: Much easier to read than the PMBOK, and not as densely packed with complex information as Rita’s prep guides
Helps build a comfort level with the subject matter
Flows easily and is a quick but helpful study guide
cons: Subject matter and sample questions may be too simple and may not adequately prepare for test

customer_reviews.title: An Innovative Alternative to the PMBOK
customer_reviews.text: Job well done to authors Jennifer Greene and Andrew Stellman on creating another wonderful Head First reference, this time for PMP prep. I was dreading ordering the new PMBOK because of how poor the reviews were for formatting alone and it dawned on me that there might be a better alternative. Enter Head First PMP. I loved the format so much I gifted my copy to a colleague who is taking a PMP prep course and am ordering another for myself! Highly recommend this book to those who want a more "brain friendly" approach to PMP prep!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Muskopf

customer_reviews.title: I passed PMP using this book
customer_reviews.text: The best guide. Indeed, this book is a brain friendly material which has effectively helped crack PMP with “above the target” score. You would never realize how the concepts are being etched into brain, thanks to the scientific approach based on cognitive psychology. Conversational & friendly style makes it even more interesting, if not engrossing. Strongly recommended for PMP aspirants.
customer_reviews.author: Jabir

customer_reviews.title: PMBOK explained simply
customer_reviews.text: If you find Rita's book or others too dry, then this book is for you. If you have a reading disability, then the Kindle version of this book with a Kindle Fire is the only option that will read to you while following along in the paperback version. This is the only way that I will be able to learn the PMBOK enough to pass the PMP exam. Besides the above points, the 4th edition Head First PMP book is well evolved and will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Processes updated but chapter names were not
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the processess were indeed updated to match the 6th version of PMBOK but the chapters are still the old chapters e.g. resource management is still called Human resource management. Would be nice if someone could concur/commenf
customer_reviews.author: Peter willems

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful, Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: I am at the beginning of pursuing PMP Certification. The online course I'm taking for my 35 contact hours recommended reading an exam prep book before starting the online course. I'm glad I chose this one. It's not a dry read at all. It's very engaging and there's a variety of exercises and quiz styles to help you test your learning. My favorite were the end of chapter crossword puzzles. This book will keep you engaged and teach you a TON!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: High quality instructional design that works
customer_reviews.text: After years working in Instructional Design, it’s painful to sit through lousy online ed or sludge through thick, poorly designed textbooks. This book is not that! The design, the layout, the concept scaffolding, the retrieval patterns, the image triggers— they have taken the best research in how the brain learns, and built an excellent PMP guide from it. So happy to have found this. (And yes, I passed that PMP exam on the first try.) Thanks for putting together an excellent resource.
customer_reviews.author: A K Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Lovely book, not good on Kendle
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and I will use it to prepare for the exam. However, I didn't like how it looks on the kindle app on my PC. The app is very limited (no zoom for example) and also does not display well on my Surface Pro 4. Also, the book layout is different from the printed and the PDF books. it is really bad and messy I wish I had went for the hard copy or bought the PDF on eBooks.com or something
customer_reviews.author: Yasser Helmy Youssef

customer_reviews.title: An attempt at making PMP studying entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I like the concept. I guess I understand the structure and teaching/learning approach of a textbook and this book is definitely not like that. I just started thumbing through the book, therefore, I do not have a strong opinion either way. The book itself is low quality. The print on every page, including the cover is skewed at 10 degrees. I doubt this was done on purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Feeling blue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect study companion for the PMI CAPM exam as well
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased both the third and fourth editions of this book in the last five or so years, and both proved indispensable for passing the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) exam. While that exam is far less comprehensive than the full PMP exam, this book covers the same practices and content. The visual approach was perfect for my learning style.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Yeargin

customer_reviews.title: Great reference for the PMP exam
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the approach that the authors used for this work to prepare for the PMP exam. It should not be the ONLY reference material that you use, however. The questions in the book are very much like the current (Oct 2019) exam, however, there are simply too few questions to get one well-prepared for the exam. If you are unfamiliar with the style and format of the way PMI does business as I was, this reference is vital.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Elston

customer_reviews.title: Must-have study companion for PMP
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased both the 8th and 9th Edition of Rita Mulcahy’s PMP Exam Prep Book and as comprehensive as it is, it is very challenging to read and study. Head First PMP makes studying for the PMP very entertaining and interesting. I haven’t yet taken the PMP test and very likely to return to provide an update but this book, the 4th edition is so very good! Just read the ‘fireside chats’ conversation on page 206 and had to suspend my reading to come give this review. So much fun while at the same time, learning!
customer_reviews.author: Skent

customer_reviews.title: Helped me pass the PMP exam
customer_reviews.text: I took a boot camp and failed my first attempt at the PMP exam. While the boot camp gave me a basic understanding, this book really helped pull it all together and helped me understand much better. I don't think I would have been as successful on my second exam without it. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone getting their PMP. I actually enjoyed studying because of the book and it kept me engaged. The practice test questions are good and I even had some on my real exam which were eerily similar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alliterative to PMBOK
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I would not have passed without this book. It's all in how the information is displayed, it's relatable. While I didn't rely solely on this book. I recommend it all of my counterparts who are studying for the exam and want a good extra resource. The material is laid out with good explanations and the pictures and exercises make it easy to remember the material. On my practice exams, I noticed a good increase in the areas I studied and exercised in the book.
customer_reviews.author: CoronersDisciple

customer_reviews.title: I Passed!
customer_reviews.text: I used this book to study along with the PMBOK and pass the PMP exam on the first try so of course I would recommend it. It's really is "brain friendly." I didn't feel overwhelmed and tired after reading it. Some of the exercises I didn't care for but I liked all the practice questions at the end of each chapter and full exam at the end. It was a great way to gauge how I my studying was going.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: PMP Exam Prep not a Dry Read -- at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Hi --I am using this book to help me prep for the PMP exam certification. First, I will tell you that one of my colleagues recommended this book. She said; its an easier read than the dry read of the PMBOK. And I will agree to that. The format of this book has helped me to get through a lot of the terminology because the book applies scenarios that are both humorous and interesting. In a few months I will update my post with more and perhaps then I will update my ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Helpful
customer_reviews.text: The narratives were pretty helpful to understand the PMBOK. If you have ever tried to read the PMBOK it is like s like drinking sand. A few things though they should consider on another edition. The end of chapter highlight were excellent for review, however, Risk, Procurement and Stakeholder were lacking or missing. Also, I wish they had aligned their subchapters with the numerical system from the PMBOK. It would have been clearer to see those numbers to know where I was when I was studying with both open.
customer_reviews.author: Luvtoteachart

customer_reviews.title: Best PMP training book
customer_reviews.text: I've tried using other books and they were like reading medical books. This book is formatted great! The side notes is like having a teacher talking to you. The questions on the practice exams are identical to the ones you will see on the test. If you do well on the Practice exam you should feel very comfortable about taking the real test.
customer_reviews.author: scott harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issue?
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good overall but all of the “What’s my purpose?” Exercises give the questions and choices in numbers but the answers are in numbers and alphabets. Looks like a problem with quality! LOL
customer_reviews.author: NJJ

customer_reviews.title: PMP that makes sense
customer_reviews.text: This is the first book you should read if you are going for the PMP. It is very well written and explains (everything that it covers) very well with diagrams and examples. The downside is that it does not cover everything, so I would advise reading Rita Mulcahy's PMP Exam Prep after reading this. Rita covers more material, but is a much harder read. Both books have plenty of sample test questions.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Passed my PMP exam with this book
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a great book, it helped me a lot to pass the exam on my first attempt. Some comments on it: You have to read along with the chapters on the PMBOK guide to have a better understanding. Also the questions on the book are easier compared to the exam, so other practice exams should be done. At least reading the two books together is more entertaining that only the PMBOK. The figures and approach makes it interesting and keeps you into the subject. It should not be used alone to pass the exam, that is for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Creative and PMP ready book
customer_reviews.text: By far the best PMP book ever. Don't purchase another book. You can pass the test with this book. Love the humor, love the conversation in it, love the layout, and love how it actually explains the concepts. You can't pass the PMP without this.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Terry

customer_reviews.title: Useful, Applicable, and Engaging Text
customer_reviews.text: Very informative and easy to apply. Loved their accessible-to-all approach to learning. My 3rd PMP exam prep textbook purchase, but I wish I had purchased it first~ Update: I took the exam in April, only a month after I started using this book. I passed the exam on my first attempt!
customer_reviews.author: Stephenie King

customer_reviews.title: Hard to follow and understand
customer_reviews.text: The book's so-claimed "unique visual" format actually made it very hard to follow and understand. Only a few pages in, it already made my head spin. Will not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Happyshopgal

customer_reviews.title: Good Learning Approach, But Many Typos
customer_reviews.text: Read this book before another prep book and it helped a lot. The way the chapters are structured with scenarios and pictures was fun and easy to stay focused. However, there were so many typos that I noticed that if I didn’t have a second book to reference too, I would be so confused. Example is that lead and lag was switched on one of the quizzes at the end. Another example is a quiz question that asked which is not an input, but all the choices were actual inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Chen

customer_reviews.title: PMP Study
customer_reviews.text: The book, so far, is very easy to follow and read. Bought to study for the upcoming PMP certification test. Like it because it is very conversational and has examples to work through with answers. It is similar in format to the PMBOK. Good additional training book.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Book
customer_reviews.text: If u are not theory person then this book is for you.everything is explained with examples and diagrams.Love the way they make us understand.
customer_reviews.author: Rohini

customer_reviews.title: Passed my exam ...
customer_reviews.text: I had previously failed the exam twice and I had used Rita Mulchahy and Andy Crowe's book, This book is very helpful if you are a visual person , it explains everything in simple terms and with real life examples. I recommend this book hands down.
customer_reviews.author: ludovico tasoni

customer_reviews.title: Passed the PMP!
customer_reviews.text: This definitely helped me pass the PMP exam. It’s a lot better than a lot of the courses you find online. I used it in addition to a course in LinkedIn and the PMBOK.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G

customer_reviews.title: Good Material for CAPM Preparation
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book for Individuals preparing for CAPM test. Writers have done great job to make the subject matter engaging as well as easy to grasp. They have done even better job explaining mathematical problem with examples and practice questions.
customer_reviews.author: The Human

customer_reviews.title: Concepts are made clear
customer_reviews.text: I passed 1st try on March 6, 2020. This was my main guide - cover to cover. The intentional repetition and hands on exercises are more valuable than you know.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: This is really good. I'm overwhelmed in general. But this book helps to keep me from getting confused by all of the information.
customer_reviews.author: Love and Grace

customer_reviews.title: It helped me pass my PMP exam
customer_reviews.text: My PMP boot camp instructor recommended this book and I immediately bought it. The book layout is unlike any other prep book I have ever seen. It’s very interactive and the authors apply simplistic but realistic and great examples/scenarios based on all the PM processes and knowledge areas. In my opinion, I wouldn't have passed my exam (with flying colors) without this book!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for a excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Great item, great shipper! Product in perfect condition! Thank you, this is perfect for understanding the PMBOK guide.
customer_reviews.author: WK Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: The size of the book is intimidating, thick phone book thickness, but it is well written and thorough.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: A must for the PMP test
customer_reviews.text: This book makes learning the PMP information easy to comprehend
customer_reviews.author: Top8999

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent study guide. I prepped for 2 months before I sat for the exam. This guide is easy to understand & not boring to read.
customer_reviews.author: Lboogie

customer_reviews.title: Essential study guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have book to study for the PMP. Studied the whole book after taking a class and passed on first attempt!
customer_reviews.author: vpage

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: PMP is dry!!! This book Makes it fun to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Ari312

customer_reviews.title: The pages are missing
customer_reviews.text: Book is ok, but would be great if all the pages were in the book. Missing pages, 48, 49, (these 2 were answers to questions in the book) 60, 258, 422, 738, 724, 640, 578,
customer_reviews.author: randall  diehl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great for studying, passed on the first try! Of course, also used Velociteach book and boot camp. But used the Head First to pass the CAPM.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kranz

customer_reviews.title: Great Study Guide
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read for this type of book and a great study guide.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn
customer_reviews.text: Great for learning the concepts and preparing for the exam!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I love headfirst. They always deliver the information in an easy to understand manner.
customer_reviews.author: Victor A. Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Liked it for PMP!
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning for PMP this is the right supplemental book.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Azim SIRAJ

customer_reviews.title: A great source in passing the PMP
customer_reviews.text: Five stars as it was my No.1 source in passing the PMP. I chose this book based on Amazon’s reviews and found it very helpful in my exam preparations.
customer_reviews.author: Baqer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best books that I could read about PMP
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this book to all person who is starting in PMP, it has a lot of examples and explain all the tools and techniques.
customer_reviews.author: Elthon Chocano

customer_reviews.title: Good resource for PMP prep
customer_reviews.text: Nice graphics, made it easy to follow the processes. I really liked the repetition throughout the book to reinforce the concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A Darby

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A MUST FOR PMP EXAM PREP!
customer_reviews.text: I was so discouraged before I found this book. Taking the videos and reading the PMBOK guide were not helping me understand. I was sure to fail the test using those. Then I found this book and everything is finally understandable. Really can't thank the writers enough for saving me!!!
customer_reviews.author: lovechicklit

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool to learn PMP
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read. Very entertaining. Hope to pass the exam
customer_reviews.author: Angel Tejeda
